title: Teurastamo
text:
Teurastamo (; literally meaning "abattoir") is a <a href="public%20area">public area</a> managed by Tukkutori in <a href="Hermanni%20%28Helsinki%29">Hermanni</a>, <a href="Helsinki">Helsinki</a>, <a href="Finland">Finland</a>, which hosts events, <a href="restaurant">restaurant</a> and <a href="Bar%20%28establishment%29">bar</a> operations and other urban culture. The area is located along the Työpajankatu street near the <a href="Kalasatama">Kalasatama</a> area.
The name of the area, "Teurastamo", is derived from the city's former <a href="slaughterhouse">slaughterhouse</a>, designed by architect Bertel Liljequist and opened in 1933. The slaughterhouse closed in 1992 and has since housed smaller <a href="butcher">butcher</a>s, <a href="bakery">bakeries</a> and other food and flower businesses. The area was officially opened to the general public in the autumn of 2012.
Teurastamo is run by more than a dozen active players, from <a href="Distillery">distilleries</a> to restaurants and <a href="coffee%20roaster">coffee roaster</a>s. Notable restaurants in the area include the Restaurant Kellohalli, the Restaurant Palema, and Roslund, the "Gate of Teurastamo", known for its <a href="Hamburger">burgers</a>. Teurastamo also includes a yard and <a href="barbecue">barbecue</a> for free use all year round by the townspeople, a <a href="bicycle">bicycle</a> <a href="repair">repair</a> point, a sack-growing area and a <a href="sauna">sauna</a> for rent. A variety of free events are held in Teurastamo's yard, such as <a href="picnic">picnic</a>s, a <a href="farmers%20market">farmers market</a>-style markets and <a href="flea%20market">flea market</a>s.
